chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Philip P Capone III was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Dept.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
11:05 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - received a letter from Father Krogman.  Both counsel confirm receipt of that letter.

Atty Privat has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions but will discuss during sentencing argument.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by Kevin Shippman.  Statement by Jim Mueller.  Statement by Dave Harding.  Statement by Randy Prahl.  Statement by Steve Doro.  

Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

5 years Wisconsin State Prison, with 2 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-$600 fine plus court costs - Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Blood Draw Fee $42.50 (prison money verbage as above)
-DL revocation - 2 years
-IID - 2 years
-AODA Assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-No premises licensed to sell alcohol-by-the drink - no bars or taverns.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from July 5, 2015 to today.

Sentence to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 11:39 a.m.
Miscellaneous
Sentencing hearing at 03-08-2016 11:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 12-15-2015 01:30 pm

10:05 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - sent a copy of the PSI to the defendant and has not had the opportunity to go over it with him.  Court sets for a Sentencing on December 15, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:06 a.m.
to counsel with copy of the Pre-sentence investigation report.
to Agent Pulice - request for extension to file the PSI has been approved.  PSI is to be filed on or before November 23, 2015.
from Agent Pulice dated October 23, 2015 - requests an extension to file the PSI
Sentencing hearing at 12-08-2015 10:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 11-09-2015 09:30 am

2:41 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat .  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to OWI - 4th offense and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged to count 1.  Court orders counts 2-6 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days.  Upon filing copies are to be disbursed.  Court sets for Sentencing on November 9, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:47 p.m.


Note:  After Court - spoke with Judge, confirmed that bond is revoked and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Green Lake County Jail pending the filing of the PSI.

10:32 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and will involve a request for a PSI and requests this matter be called later today.  No objection by DA Christenson to recall later.  Court adjourns to jail call.

Court adjourned at 10:33 a.m.
Defendant's
For Discovery (Defendant's)
State's
By Atty Barb Privat

9:07 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  State has received a copy of the motion for reduction of bail.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by DA - opposes the request for bond modification.  Court denies the defendant's motion.

Court adjourned at 9:09 a.m.
for Reduction of Bail
Status hearing at 08-24-2015 09:30 am

1:42 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court with the PAC charge as count 6.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on August 24, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:46 p.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  No violent contact with Michelle B.
Preliminary hearing at 07-14-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  No violent contact with Michelle B.

2:46 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Statement by defendant.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $2,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  No violent contact with Michelle B.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on July 14, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:54 p.m.
